title: India-China ties: PM Modi stresses 'strategic autonomy'; message for Trump?
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Xi Jinping, during the SCO Summit in Tianjin, affirmed India and China as development partners, not rivals, emphasising the need to prevent differences from escalating into disputes. They acknowledged their crucial role in stabilising global trade amid US tariffs and discussed expanding bilateral trade, investment and reducing the trade deficit. PM Modi invited Xi to the BRICS summit in India in 2026, highlighting strengthened bilateral relations.

title: 'India not schoolkid': US journalist slams Trump’s Russia oil tariffs
content: American journalist Rick Sanchez of Russia Today has criticized the US for imposing secondary tariffs on India over Russian oil, calling it disrespectful and ignorant. He highlighted India's autonomy in choosing oil suppliers as a transformational moment, noting India's significance on the global stage.

title: 33 killed, 7 lakh evacuated: Pak's Punjab faces biggest flood in history
content: Severe flooding in Pakistan's Punjab province, exacerbated by global warming, has impacted two million people, marking the region's biggest flood in history. Heavy monsoon rains have caused three rivers to reach unprecedented water levels, leading to widespread evacuations and significant damage.

title: Internet in 1995: Bill Gates got ‘made fun of’ for this
content: In a resurfaced 1995 interview, Bill Gates faced laughter on The Late Show with David Letterman while explaining the internet's potential. Gates described features like online publishing, email, and niche communities, met with skepticism and jokes. The clip now highlights the contrast between initial disbelief and the internet's current ubiquitous role.

title: Kerala bank canteen row: Manager bans beef; staff serve dish in protest
content: Employees of Canara Bank in Kochi, under the BEFI banner, protested against the regional manager's alleged ban on serving beef in the bank's canteen. The employees served beef on the premises, claiming the manager, instructed the canteen staff to exclude the dish due to his personal dietary preferences.

title: 'Fuelling anti-semitism fire': Why are Israel and US angry at Macron?
content: French President Emmanuel Macron’s decision to recognise a Palestinian state has drawn sharp criticism from Israel and the US. Netanyahu accused Macron of “fueling antisemitism,” while Macron defended the move as vital for peace and in response to Gaza’s humanitarian crisis. The US backed Israel, even as several countries plan similar recognition during the upcoming UN General Assembly.

title: 19-year-old athlete killed in road accident with SMC garbage van in Surat
content: Vidhi Kadam, a 19-year-old athlete and B.Com student, tragically died in Surat after her scooter collided with an SMC garbage van. The accident occurred while she was on her way to the gym. The van driver, who only possessed a learner's license, has been arrested. Vidhi was a promising athlete, holding records and with aspirations for state and national competitions.

title: Apple & Samsung to Xiaomi: Stop using our phones; 'cease and desist' notice sent
content: Apple and Samsung have reportedly initiated legal action against Xiaomi in India over advertisements that allegedly disparage their products. These ads directly compared Xiaomi's offerings to Apple's iPhones and Samsung's smartphones and televisions, questioning their value and technology.

title: Spurned lover out on bail stabs woman for second time in three years
content: The woman suffered head injuries and was admitted to a private hospital in Kuniyamuthur, where her condition is stable.

title: 'How many more days in this?': Rishabh Pant's injury update goes viral
content: Rishabh Pant is determined to get back on the cricket field after fracturing his toe during the Test match against England. Pant shared a photo of his bandaged foot on Instagram, expressing his eagerness to recover.

title: 'Threatened to fail': UP school principal rapes 11-year-old student
content: In Aligarh, a government school principal has been arrested and suspended following allegations of raping an 11-year-old Class 7 student. The principal, aged 50, is accused of sexually assaulting the girl, performing obscene acts, and threatening to fail her if she resisted.

title: US emabassy: Discontinued from Aug; only two options left for passport/visa pickup
content: Starting August 1, 2025, the U.S. will no longer allow third-party passport collection. Applicants must collect their passports in person, with parental collection required for those under 18 with a consent letter. Alternatively, applicants can opt for home delivery at a cost of Rs 1,200 per applicant, ensuring enhanced security.

title: 'Endangering health': Sanders urges Trump's health secretary to resign
content: Senator Bernie Sanders has urged US health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr to resign, citing actions endangering public health. Sanders criticizes Kennedy's anti-vaccine stance and promotion of debunked conspiracy theories, highlighting the dismissal of the CDC director and resignations of other officials. He warns Kennedy's policies could undermine access to essential immunizations and threaten the childhood immunization schedule.

title: 'Made me famous world over': SC judge on stray dogs case
content: Justice Vikram Nath humorously acknowledged the global attention he received after his bench overturned a ruling on stray dogs in Delhi-NCR. He expressed gratitude to CJI BR Gavai for assigning him the case, noting the widespread recognition, even from dogs.

title: Pavitra Rishta fame Priya Marathe passes away at 38 after battle with cancer
content: Television actress Priya Marathe, known for her roles in Marathi and Hindi serials, passed away at her Mumbai residence on August 31 at the age of 38. She had been battling cancer for several years. Marathe gained recognition for her performances in 'Kasamh Se,' 'Pavitra Rishta,' and 'Bade Acche Lagte Hain,' leaving behind a legacy of memorable characters and versatility.

title: US tariffs: India readies steps to protect exporters; domestic demand push in focus
content: In response to the US tariff hike, the government is preparing measures to protect industries and workers, focusing on employment-heavy sectors. Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur expressed confidence in achieving the fiscal deficit target, citing strong macroeconomic fundamentals, robust capex, and broad-based economic expansion reflected in the 7.8% growth in the April-June quarter.

title: ‘Forced to drink urine’: UP jail inmates allege inhuman treatment, families protest
content: A probe has been initiated in Kasganj district jail following allegations of severe inmate mistreatment. Prisoners claim they were tortured, with one forced to drink urine, after the new jail superintendent took charge. Relatives and lawyers protested inhuman treatment and extortion. A wife alleged her husband was beaten and she faced an inappropriate search.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on work obsession: Mind always on company
content: Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, revealed his intense dedication to work, blurring the lines between his professional and personal life. He admitted to constantly thinking about Nvidia, even during leisure activities, highlighting the relentless drive behind the company's success. This extreme work ethic has propelled Nvidia to a $4 trillion valuation, reflecting a culture of long hours and unwavering focus.

title: 'Right choice for India-China to be friends': PM Modi, Xi commit to taking ties forward
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi affirmed that cooperation between India and China would foster global well-being during bilateral talks with President Xi Jinping. PM Modi emphasized India's commitment to advancing ties with China based on mutual trust, respect, and sensitivity. Discussions included border management agreements, the resumption of Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, and direct flights between the two nations.

title: Hamas confirms death of its top military commander Mohammad Sinwar
content: Hamas confirmed the death of Mohammad Sinwar, its Gaza military chief. Israel reported killing him in an airstrike months ago. His body was found in a tunnel beneath a hospital in Khan Younis. Mohammad Sinwar played a key role in Hamas's command. His death follows those of other top leaders.

title: Shared festival: Karnataka village installs Ganesha idol at mosque
content: Sandigawad village in Ron taluk showcases remarkable communal harmony during Ganeshotsav. For the past three years, Hindus and Muslims have jointly celebrated the festival for five days, with the Ganesha idol installed within the local mosque premises. Muslims actively support the Hindu rituals, while Hindus participate in Ramzan, fostering unity.

title: DPL 2025: Nitish Rana credits Hanuman Chalisa for his form
content: Nitish Rana, attributing his form to carrying the Hanuman Chalisa, propelled West Delhi Lions into the DPL 2025 final. They secured an eight-wicket victory against East Delhi Riders, chasing down 140 with ease. Rana's unbeaten 45 complemented Ayush Doseja's steady 54. Earlier, the Riders struggled, posting only 139/8. The Lions now face Central Delhi Kings in a highly anticipated final.

title: ‘Favorite player’: LeRoy Butler’s Lambeau Leap lesson to Micah Parsons
content: In a stunning NFL trade, Micah Parsons joins the Green Bay Packers from the Dallas Cowboys. The Packers acquired Parsons in exchange for two first-round picks and Kenny Clark. Packers legend LeRoy Butler welcomes Parsons by offering to teach him the Lambeau Leap and gifting his former jersey number, anticipating Parsons will elevate the team to Super Bowl contention.

title: From monsoon mayhem to Khelo India fest at Dal Lake: PM Modi's Mann Ki Baat address
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation in the 125th episode of Mann Ki Baat, expressing sorrow for the havoc caused by incessant rains and highlighting the contributions of disaster response forces. He also mentioned achievements in Jammu and Kashmir, including a cricket match in Pulwama, and spotlighted athletes from the Khelo India Water Sports Festival.

title: Watch: Israel releases Oct 7 footage; father dies shielding kids from bomb
content: Israel released disturbing security footage depicting the October 7 Hamas attack on the Taasa family home. The video shows a Hamas militant killing firefighter Gil Taasa as he shielded his two sons from a grenade. Injured by shrapnel, the boys witnessed their father's death and were later offered drinks by a fighter before the family's eldest son was also killed.

title: Haryanvi actor-singer accuses Bhojpuri star Pawan Singh of inappropriate touch
content: A Haryanvi actor-singer has accused a Bhojpuri actor-singer of inappropriate touching during a promotional event in Lucknow. She shared her experience on Instagram, expressing anger and humiliation, and stated she will not work in the Bhojpuri industry again. The accused's manager dismissed the allegations as a misunderstanding, while a Bhojpuri Samaj leader condemned the incident.

title: Bank Holidays in September: On what days will banks be closed? Check list
content: In September 2025, banks across India will observe several holidays, including Karma Puja, Onam, Id-e-Milad, Indrajatra, Navratra Sthapna, and Durga Puja. These holidays will affect bank operations in various states, with closures varying regionally.

title: IITs exceed intake limits: Admissions soar in 2025; why the sudden rise?
content: For the first time, IITs have admitted more students than their sanctioned capacity in 2025. Against 18,160 seats, 18,188 were allotted through JoSAA to minimise vacancies. IIT Bombay, Delhi, Kharagpur, and Kanpur exceeded intake, highlighting both demand and infrastructure challenges. With government-backed expansion and rising female representation, IITs continue to operate at, and beyond, their capacity.

title: UP T20 League: Rinku Singh delivers another explosive knock - watch
content: Rinku Singh showcased his exceptional form in the UP T20 League, further solidifying his reputation as a reliable finisher. He smashed an unbeaten 78 off 48 balls, leading Meerut Mavericks to a seven-wicket victory. His recent performances, including a century against Gorakhpur Lions, highlight his readiness for the Asia Cup, where his middle-order prowess could be crucial for India.

title: Row erupts after UP principal asks students to remove ‘tilak, kalawa’
content: A private school in Bulandshahr initially prohibited students from wearing religious symbols like 'tilak' and 'kalawa' in classrooms, triggering immediate backlash from parents and right-wing organizations. The principal swiftly retracted the order and issued an apology, acknowledging the impact on religious sentiments. The education department has launched an investigation into the matter following the protests.

title: Putin arrives in China; calls for 'fairer multipolar world order'
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in Tianjin, China, for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit hosted by President Xi Jinping. Accompanied by a large delegation, Putin aims to bolster the SCO's ability to address global challenges and strengthen Eurasian solidarity. He emphasized the SCO's principles of equality and respect, envisioning a fairer, multipolar world order.

title: ‘If someone pokes me, I won’t sit quietly’: Nitish Rana hits back at Digvesh Rathi
content: Nitish Rana addressed his on-field spat with Digvesh Rathi during the Delhi Premier League Eliminator, stating Rathi initiated the confrontation. Rana defended his aggressive response, emphasizing his upbringing taught him to stand up for himself when provoked. He highlighted his match-winning innings as a consequence of being challenged, asserting he never starts fights but always retaliates.

title: Nagaland journalist shot at during festival coverage in Manipur
content: In Manipur's Senapati district, journalist Dip Saikia, working for a Nagaland-based satellite news channel, was shot while covering a flower festival. Villagers apprehended the assailant, who is now being questioned. The channel editor strongly condemned the attack, calling it an assault on press freedom and democratic values.

title: Trump tariffs: India halts US-mail including up to $100 parcels
content: India's postal department has halted all mail bookings to the United States due to new US regulations impacting incoming shipments. This suspension includes letters, documents, and gifts valued up to $100. The decision follows a US executive order removing duty-free allowances and requiring comprehensive data exchange, which Indian carriers are currently unable to meet.

title: 8 Bengali workers assaulted in Odisha; 1 survives to tell tale of horror
content: Eight migrant workers from Murshidabad were brutally assaulted in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, by a mob who accused them of being 'Bangladeshi cattle thieves'. Abdul Alim, one of the victims, recounted the horrific attack, stating that the attackers chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' while beating them. He managed to escape and return home, while the others are reportedly receiving treatment in Bhubaneswar.

title: CBSE opens new space: Classes 9–12 on podcasts; real dialogue with students
content: CBSE has launched a nationwide initiative inviting students of Classes IX–XII to participate in podcasts and social media platforms like YouTube. Through videos, audio clips, and testimonials, students can share their voices on academic and personal matters. Schools can nominate students within 10 days via a Google form. The program aims to enhance communication, confidence, and digital engagement.

title: Air India flight returns to Delhi after 'fire indication'; passengers shifted
content: An Air India flight AI2913, en route to Indore, made an emergency return to Delhi shortly after takeoff on Sunday due to a fire warning in its right engine. Following standard safety protocols, the cockpit crew shut down the affected engine and executed a safe landing.

title: India-China ties: PM Modi, Xi Jinping hold meeting on sidelines of SCO
content: Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping met in Tianjin. Modi stressed the importance of cooperation between India and China. He noted that the interests of both nations are intertwined. Agreements on border management were reached. The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra has resumed. Direct flights between the two countries are restarting. India aims to strengthen relations with China based on trust and respect.

title: Week 1 showed us what we got right and wrong this offseason -- and we got plenty wrong
content: We might not be through the opening scenes, but we've already upended the Heisman race and slayed a giant.

title: Bama can't stop Castellanos as FSU stuns Tide
content: New quarterback Tommy Castellanos led a punishing rushing attack for Florida State with 78 yards and a touchdown as the Noles stunned No. 8 Alabama.

title: Kelly's Tigers deflect 'doubters,' topple Clemson
content: A gritty performance on the road Saturday allowed No. 9 LSU to end its five-game losing streak in openers with a 17-10 victory over No. 4 Clemson, its first Week 1 win since record-setting QB Joe Burrow and his high-flying offense went undefeated in 2019.

title: DeBoer: 'No excuses' for Tide's tumble in Tally
content: Alabama coach Kalen DeBoer said after a disappointing 31-17 loss to Florida State on Saturday there are "no excuses" for what happened to a No. 8 Crimson Tide team that came into the season opener as a nearly two-touchdown favorite over the Seminoles.

title: Lynx clinch home court in playoffs with 31st win
content: The Lynx clinched home-court advantage throughout the WNBA playoff as they won their franchise-record 31st game Saturday.

title: Manning struggles vs. lofty expectations in debut
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning struggled in his starting debut, completing 17 of 30 passes for 170 yards with 1 TD and 1 interception in the loss.

title: Jonah Winston, brother of Jameis, commits to FSU
content: Florida State landed a legacy commitment Saturday night when class of 2026 athlete Jonah Winston, the brother of former Seminoles Heisman Trophy winner Jameis Winston, announced his pledge shortly after the program upset No. 8 Alabama.

title: Ostapenko apologizes for words toward Townsend
content: Jelena Ostapenko apologized on social media Saturday, three days after telling Taylor Townsend that she had "no class" and "no education" following their second-round match at the US Open.

title: Ducks mascot trips, loses head in costume mishap
content: Oregon's mascot had an embarrassing moment Saturday when he ran out on the field at Autzen Stadium and tripped, causing the head of his costume to fly off.

title: 🏈 Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Lee Corso's farewell to 'GameDay': Behind the scenes of a football celebration﻿
content: Fans, many without tickets to the game, came from all over the country to Columbus to get a glimpse of Corso one last time.

title: Any win will do for Amorim on this Man United roller coaster of emotions
content: Manchester United's victory over Burnley was far from convincing, but after their nightmare in Grimsby, Ruben Amorim will take anything he can get.

title: VAR controversy masks Chelsea's issues in win over Fulham
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca will have to concede that his side was lucky to beat Fulham on Saturday.

title: The Americans still playing at the 2025 US Open
content: There have been a few notable upsets, but six Americans still remain in the US Open draw. Here's who to watch as the fourth round begins.﻿

title: Coco Gauff vs. Naomi Osaka: Who will win?
content: Naomi Osaka and Coco Gauff will meet in the fourth round on Monday night. And it's more of a toss-up than recent results suggest.

title: Four questions in the Micah Parsons trade aftermath: Why in the world would Dallas do this?
content: What are the Cowboys doing? Did they get enough in return? And does Parsons put the Packers at the top of the NFC? Let's sort through this wild trade.

title: A new look in Green Bay: Parsons trade continues Packers' aggressive offseason
content: Signs of change in Green Bay include paying up to trade for Parsons after finally taking a WR in the first round.

title: Chasing history: Can Derrick Henry run past seven Hall of Famers to reach top 10 all time?
content: The Baltimore Ravens running back sits at No. 19 on the rushing list and has a chance to bypass seven Hall of Famers.

title: College football betting: Go with the experienced Irish or wild-card Canes?
content: The Fighting Irish head to Miami as small favorites after making it to the national championship game last season. Here's how to bet the game.

title: Betting NFL milestones: Mike Evans and Derrick Henry chasing down history
content: Potential career milestones are on the horizon for several players. We predict if they get there in 2025.

title: Guide to the NFL's rookie class: Who is flying under the radar? Who will win OROY, DROY?
content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners, fantasy favorites and QB updates.

title: Let's predict the draft: Kiper's 10 preseason takes, including why all eyes are on Penn State
content: How many quarterbacks will go in Round 1? Mel Kiper Jr. makes predictions for the 2026 NFL draft class.

title: Toto Wolff admits he misses 'great enemy' Christian Horner in F1
content: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff has admitted he misses having his "great enemy" Christian Horner in the Formula 1 paddock after Horner was sacked by Red Bull after 20 years in charge of the team.

title: From Collier to Clark and more: How injury returns could impact the playoffs
content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

title: Debunking your favorite NFL officiating conspiracy theories
content: Are the refs penalizing some teams more than others? Which coaches win challenges? We crunched the numbers.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: Liz Loza's draft rules (there are none!), five players to pick and two to fade
content: It's finally time to make picks, so consider the trends surrounding these players as you prepare your draft board.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a championship-winning manager.

title: Baylor's anthracite and chrome combo headline best college football uniforms from Week 1
content: While Baylor revives its gold chrome helmets, Utah State will be donning cow print helmets that have a hilarious origin story.

title: Ben Shelton and Trinity Rodman relationship timeline
content: The NWSL player playfully challenged the tennis star with a question about his 2nd-round US Open performance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea could make late move for Barcelona star López
content: Chelsea could make a fresh offer for Barcelona star Fermín López. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: August rainfall in northwest India highest since 2001: IMD
content: South Peninsular India recorded 250.6 mm of rainfall in August, about 31% above normal, making it the third highest for the month since 2001, and the eighth highest since 1901

title: BC quota in local body elections: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy launches scathing attack on BRS, Chandrasekhar Rao for not supporting hike
content: “BRS is trying to create obstacles in the passage of Bills paving the way for implementation of 42% reservation to BCs,” Telangana CM Revanth Reddy said in a debate in the Legislative Assembly

title: Election Commission of India targets new voter cards for all Bihar voters post SIR
content: Officials said while the plan is to issue every Bihar voter with a new voter card, a final call on when and how the exercise will be carried out is yet to be taken

title: Nod for movement of multi-axle vehicles on Thamarassery Ghat Road
content: The road was completely closed to vehicular traffic on August 26 after mud slips and falling of rocks were reported on the ninth hair pin curve

title: Kerala launches new intensive mission to mitigate human-wildlife conflict
content: Help desks would be set up in affected grama panchayats and local elected representatives and officials would listen to the suggestions and complaints and try to address their concerns

title: FIR against TMC MP Mahua Moitra for ‘objectionable’ remarks against Amit Shah in Chhattisgarh
content: Mahua Moitra sparked a controversy after allegedly saying that if Mr. Shah fails to stop infiltration from Bangladesh, "the first thing you should do is cut Amit Shah's head and put it on your table"

title: PM Modi, President Xi express commitment to fair, reasonable resolution of boundary issue
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed the Chinese President Xi Jinping for the BRICS summit which India will be hosting in 2026

title: Senior IPS officer G. Venkatraman appointed as Tamil Nadu DGP in-charge
content: This is the first time in recent years Tamil Nadu is not following the Supreme Court ruling in the appointment of DGP. List of eligible DGP rank officers have been sent to UPSC for empanelment, say official sources

title: Tamil Nadu has lowest density of rosewood tree population in south India, finds study
content: Often called the “ivory of the forests,” Indian rosewood is prized for its rich grain, deep colour, and exceptional durability.

title: Godavari floods: Second warning issued at Bhadrachalam; officials discharge 10.41 lakh cusecs from Polavaram project
content: Collector K. Vetri Selvi has directed the State Disaster Response Force and the flood duty officers to be alert and take up rescue-and-rehabilitation operations in the cut-off habitations

title: Blast in firecracker factory in Lucknow, two killed
content: A part of the roof collapsed following the explosion, trapping at least two other individuals under the debris

title: HC nullifies 79% reservation in govt medical colleges in four U.P. districts
content: The State government and the Director General of Medical Education and Training opposed the petition, citing the Indira Sawhney case to argue that the 50% limit was not absolute and could be exceeded

title: Is ‘new normal’ to be defined by Chinese bullying, ‘government’s spinelessness’, asks Congress
content: The Congress also asked whether the Modi government's push on reconciliation with China is de facto legitimising its territorial aggression

title: Government readying ‘action plan’ to help exporters manage liquidity crunch and maintain order levels
content: According to sources, the short-term measures include providing immediate liquidity and compliance relief to exporters and helping them maintain order levels and employment in vulnerable sectors

title: Dedicated Freight Corridor registers 47% increase in train trips in 2024-2025
content: Vacant train trips were about 34% of the total trips in 2024-25, because mostly coal and cement wagons return vacant as it is not possible to use these wagons for other products

title: Cloudburst at Chennai’s Manali; flights diverted to Bengaluru
content: For a 24-hour period ending at 8.30 a.m. on August 31, Manali experienced 27 cm of rainfall while New Manali Town and Wimco Nagar saw 26 cm and 23 cm of rainfall respectively.

title: Government working on solutions to mitigate impact of U.S. tariff hike: DEA Secretary Anuradha Thakur
content: Department of Economic Affairs (DEA) Secretary said the government has taken some steps and more are in the offing to perk up domestic demand, which could also provide some support to manufacturing units feeling heat of U.S. tariffs

title: Natural disasters testing country: PM Modi in 'Mann Ki Baat'
content: The Prime Minister hailed the efforts of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), and security forces during the rescue operation amid mayhem

title: PM Modi-Xi Jinping meeting: India, China should handle ties from long-term perspective, says Chinese President
content: In an apparent dig at U.S. President Donald Trump’s unilateral policies, Mr. Xi said both countries should uphold multilateralism

title: Exercise Yudh Kaushal 3.0 demonstrates next-gen combat readiness in Eastern Himalayas
content: Army officials said Yudh Kaushal 3.0 validated combat effectiveness in harsh terrain while reinforcing the force’s shift towards multi-domain operations and adoption of emerging technologies

title: SC to hear on September 1 plea over sale of 20% ethanol blended petrol
content: The plea, filed by advocate Akshay Malhotra, has sought a direction to the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas to ensure availability of ethanol-free petrol at all fuel stations

title: PM Modi notes importance of peace in border areas at meeting with Xi
content: The Chinese President said that “cooperative pas de deux of the dragon and the elephant should be the right choice for the two countries”.

title: Jammu & Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah directs admin to ensure relief, rehabilitation of cloudburst-hit residents of Warwan Valley
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah expressed deep anguish over the damage caused by flash floods in Warwan, Kishtwar

title: India rains LIVE: Northwest India recorded 265 mm rainfall in August, highest for month since 2001: IMD
content: J&K government has set up a committee of officers to conduct survey of the damages caused by recent incessant rains in the migrant camps across Jammu

title: Govt links green credits for tree plantation to survival, canopy cover
content: This makes the methodology outcome-based, linking credits to actual ecological improvement rather than just plantation activity

title: Maratha quota protest: 3rd day of Jarange's hunger strike as talks with govt fail to yield solution
content: The Maratha leader slammed Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis for sending retired High Court judge Sandeep Shinde, who heads a committee set up to expedite the process of granting reservation to the community, to hold talks with him

title: Punjab floods: Congress’s Warring alleges mismanagement of dams
content: Warring asked why water was allowed to accumulate in the dams upstream and not released on time in a phased manner despite a forecast of heavy rains. It is more of a "criminal negligence" than an unforeseen natural disaster, he said

title: Several places in Chennai record more than 100 mm rainfall; light rain forecast for August 31
content: Data provided by the Tamil Nadu State Disaster Management Authority showed Ayanavaram New Taluk office recorded 96 mm, Tondiarpet CD Hospital 102.40 mm, and Ambattur Taluk office 105 mm

title: Air India Indore-bound flight returns to Delhi after 'fire indication'
content: The aircraft has been grounded for inspection, and passengers are being transferred to an alternative aircraft which will operate the flight to Indore shortly, Air India said

title: In Frames: Mud, rock, and water
content: Environmentalists and urban planning experts have blamed rampant construction in the mountains and flawed urban planning for the flooding of the towns and cities

title: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin reaches Düsseldorf
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister was welcomed by TN Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa and Deputy Chief of Mission in the Embassy of India

title: PM Modi in China LIVE: PM Modi says we are committed to take forward our ties, President Xi says it is vital to be friends
content: “We are committed to take forward our ties based on mutual trust, respect and sensitivity,” says PM Narendra Modi; “Dragon and elephant have to unite,” urges Chinese President Xi Jinping

title: CREDAI, realtors say doubling registration fee will dampen resurging public mood after pandemic
content: The realty market has been facing a slump for multiple quarters now in the State, evident in how the Department of Stamps and Registrations has missed multiple revenue targets

title: HAL likely to deliver 2 Tejas Mark-1A jets next month: Defence Secretary
content: Mr. Singh also said that the government is likely to ink a fresh contract with HAL for procuring an additional batch of 97 Tejas jets after the delivery of the two aircraft

title: The challenges of inter-State migrant workers in Tamil Nadu
content: While workers from the northern and eastern parts of India have become an essential part of Tamil Nadu’s labour force, all is not quite well on this front. Unequal wages, job uncertainty, social isolation, and lack of access to services continue to stand in the way. Shankari Nivethitha B. finds out what the State can do to improve their lot

title: Prohibitory orders imposed in Nellore after video ‘plotting murder’ of MLA surfaces
content: A video of three rowdy sheeters discussing murdering Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy goes viral on social media

title: Tourism Minister accuses YSRCP of resorting to misleading campaign on TTD land allotments
content: The NDA government held discussions with Mumtaz Hotel and allotted 25 acres of land to it at a location outside the TTD limits and cancelled the earlier allotment, says Kandula Durgesh

title: Microbes that digest plastic may also fuel antibiotic resistance
content: An IISER Kolkata has raised the troubling possibility that those microbes capable of breaking down plastics are also reservoirs of antibiotic resistance genes; plastic particles may serve as hotbeds where the genes accumulate and spread between microbes

title: Government set to reclaim Abhimaan Studio land over condition violations
content: The land in question originally was part of the Turahalli State Forest, as the erstwhile Mysore government had declared 62 acres and 20 guntas in Survey No. 26 of Mylasandra village as reserve forest in 1935, Karnataka Forest Minister said

title: Nagaland TV journalist shot in Manipur
content: Dip Saikia, a reporter with Hornbill TV, was covering a flower festival in a village in the Senapati district; villagers caught the shooter, a youth

title: Govt. to launch Adivasi languages translation app
content: The application will have the capability to translate Bhili, Mundari, Gondi, Santali, Kui, and Garo to and from English and Hindi

title: Fewer than 50 weapons forced Pakistan to call for ceasefire: Air Marshal Tiwari
content: The senior IAF officer said some of the Pakistan targets that were “taken out” in the course of the mission were not hit even during the 1971 war

title: How did Kerala pull off digital literacy feat?
content: Who were the volunteers? Who were trained? What do the numbers tell? Which panchayat was declared the State’s first fully digitally literate panchayat? What is the plan going forward? Why is the State focusing on smartphones instead of computer literacy?

title: Action against alleged traffic rule violations during Onam revelry

title: Ernakulam KSRTC bus stand set to receive long overdue facelift

title: Deadline for evacuation of Chander Kunj apartment owners goes unmet
content: Residents refuse to vacate as the Army Welfare Housing Organisation has failed to pay advance rent to apartment owners for alternative accommodation during the demolition and reconstruction period, as agreed

title: Cusat to join hands with LG Soft India to set up innovative research lab
content: The joint initiative aims to address the critical challenges facing the rapidly expanding smart home segment

title: Keltron set to enter Zimbabwe
content: Zimbabwe’s Deputy Minister of Industry and Commerce Rajesh Kumar Indukant Modi handed over the purchase order to State Industries Minister P. Rajeeve

title: WBSSC publishes lists of tainted candidates barred from fresh recruitment in schools
content: The publication of these lists comes after a Supreme Court bench of Justice Sanjay Kumar and Justice Satish Chandra Sharma came down heavily on the WBSSC and directed that ‘tainted and ineligible’ candidates will not be able to appear for the recruitment process being carried by the Commission.

title: Sports Minister withdraws from PPP model stadium on CU campus
content: This follows objections raised by Vice-Chancellor and Syndicate members during a meeting on the project attended by V. Abdurahiman at the university

title: Make urea available for Odisha farmers, demands former CM Naveen Patnaik
content: Delay in the Talcher fertiliser plant, whose foundation stone was laid in 2018, is also a concern, said Mr. Patnaik in a letter to J.P. Nadda, Union Minister of Chemicals and Fertilisers

title: Odisha, Chhattisgarh make headway towards resolving Mahanadi River water dispute
content: A high level meeting between two States resolved that technical committees headed by the Engineers-in-chief of both States will meet weekly in September to identify and resolve critical issues

title: Centre overruled industry demands on safeguards for phone, internet tapping: RTI response
content: DoT ignored demands for independent oversight, jurisdictional clarity, compensation for interception costs; it incorporated the demand for secure communications between telcos and the  government

title: Assam’s Bodoland brings ISRO-backed space studies to classrooms
content: The Bodoland Space Education Programme was framed to motivate school students in remote areas to aim for the moon and beyond

title: PM Modi likely to visit Manipur in second week of September, first since ethnic violence erupted in 2023
content: The Prime Minister is likely to visit Imphal and Churachandpur districts in the Northeastern State where he is expected to meet people displaced from their homes due to the ethnic strife

title: Many Memoranda of Understanding signed by DMK government remain only on paper: Nainar Nagenthran
content: It has not released a white paper on how much investment has been attracted through such trips undertaken since the DMK came to power in 2021, he says

title: Registries that track medical conditions essential for research and policymaking: Soumya Swaminathan
content: Inaugurating the WIN-ICON 2025, a two-day conference organised by the Tamil Nadu and Puducherry chapter of WIN-India, she points out that lack of detailed registries in India make it difficult to track disease burden and other important health metrics

title: JSP to launch ‘Trishul’ programme after Dasara, aiming to mould activists into leaders, says Pawan Kalyan
content: As part of the programme, JSP will establish a structured framework to recognise diligent activists and offer them special membership; this will provide them with direct access to central leaders and party’s main office

title: Supreme Court Bar Association flags low representation of women in higher judiciary
content: The resolution notes no woman judge elevated in latest Supreme Court appointments; several High Courts have none

title: One stitch at a time: Saga of garment workers in Bengaluru
content: Curated from the archives of unions, the show highlights the lives of women workers who form the backbone of Bengaluru’s garment industry but remain invisible amid the focus on IT

title: PM Modi Shares Story How Madhya Pradesh Footballers Found Their Way To German Coach
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the world's attention is increasingly turning towards India and its vast untapped potential, citing the example of football players from Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol village.

title: 'Ethanol Fuel Hurts Mileage But Is Safe': Indian Automakers Amid Ethanol-Petrol Row
content: India's roll-out of fuel blended with 20% ethanol will hurt a vehicle's mileage by 2%-4% but is safe to use, a lobby group representing the country's automakers said.

title: Sports To Swadeshi Push: What PM Modi Said In Mann Ki Baat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday called upon people to take pride in "swadeshi" (made in India) products as the festival season peaks in the coming weeks.

title: PM Modi China Visit Live Updates: PM Modi, Xi Jinping's Bilateral Meet Concludes After Over An Hour
content: PM Modi China Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping held bilateral talks ahead of the two-day SCO Summit.

title: Canada's First Indian-Origin Police Chief, Del Manak, Retires After 35 Years
content: Canada's first Indian-origin police chief retired on August 27 after 35 years of service with the Vancouver and Victoria Police Departments.

title: Why Congress Nominated Mohammed Azharuddin, Professor M Kodandaram To Telangana Legislative Council
content: The initial nominations by the Congress government were challenged by the BRS, who claimed that their own nominees' recommendations had been unfairly rejected by the then-Governor.

title: 2 Dead In Explosion At Firecracker Factory Inside House In Lucknow
content: At least two people were killed and five others injured in a blast at a firecracker factory operating from a house in Lucknow's Gudamba area here on Sunday, police said.

title: 2 Terrorists Arrested In J&K's Poonch, Weapons Recovered
content: Police have arrested two terrorists with weapons in Jammu and Kashmir's border district of Poonch, officials said on Sunday.

title: India, China To Resume Direct Flights After 5 Years Of Suspension
content: India and China will resume direct flights after more than five years as two of the world's biggest economies seek to rebuild political ties amid rising trade uncertainties.

title: "Kazan Meet Marked The Reset": China On PM Modi-Xi Jinping Meeting
content: India and China shoulder the responsibility of promoting unity and advancing the progress of human society, Beijing said on Sunday, in its official statement on President Xi Jinping's meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday.

title: "Natural Disasters Testing Nation": PM As Rain Ravages Parts Of North India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday expressed pain and anguish over the devastation caused by landslides and floods triggered by incessant rains, and said natural disasters are testing the country.

title: "Milestone For Bilateral Ties": Chinese Journalist On PM Modi's China Visit
content: PM Modi and President Xi Jinping held talks on the sidelines of the two-day Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in China's Tianjin.

title: 'Neglected' By Husband, Uttar Pradesh Woman Murders Him In His Sleep
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar have arrested a woman for allegedly strangling her husband to death in his sleep for neglecting her over his first wife, officials said on Sunday.

title: "From Tomorrow, Will Stop...": Manoj Jarange's Threat Over Maratha Quota Demand
content: Activist Manoj Jarange on Sunday asserted he will not leave Mumbai until his demand for reservation to the Maratha community is met, as his hunger strike entered the third day.

title: Uttarakhand Hit By Rains, Badrinath Highway Blocked At 5 Locations
content: With nature's fury continuing in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district, heavy rain brought down debris from a boulder collapse, blocking the Badrinath Highway at five locations.

title: "Belittling Country Like India...": Geopolitics Expert Blasts Trump Tariffs
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Chinese President Xi Jinping in Tianjin this morning against the backdrop of hefty tariffs that had shaken the global economy.

title: PM Modi Holds Bilateral Talks With Xi During His 1st China Visit In 7 Years
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is holding bilateral talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping, during his first visit to China in seven years, against the backdrop of the hefty US tariffs that have brought the two nations closer despite their differences

title: Probe Agency Attaches Rs 394 Crore Assets In Bike Bot Scam Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate's Special Task Force has attached movable and immovable properties worth Rs 394.42 crore in connection with the multi-crore Bikebot scam.

title: US Putting All Kinds Of Pressure, India Will Be Dictated By None: Ex-Diplomat
content: Former diplomat Vikas Swarup on Friday said that the Trump administration is trying to put all kinds of pressure on the Indian government, but India has always followed the principle of strategic autonomy and will not be "dictated" by anyone.
